discussion.content:
Answer: A. Installation can be completed by using Click-to-Run.

Click-to-Run is a streaming and virtualization technology that allows Office ProPlus to be delivered and updated from the cloud, rather than installing the full application on the user's computer. This enables faster and more efficient deployment and updates of the software. In contrast, Office 2016 is typically installed via traditional installation methods, such as downloading an installer file or using System Center Configuration Manager.

Proplus is now named Microsoft 365 apps for Enterprise: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/about-microsoft-365-apps

O Click-to-Run é uma tecnologia de instalação usada pela Microsoft para implementar o Microsoft Office, incluindo o Office 365 ProPlus. Ao contrário das instalações tradicionais baseadas em MSI (Microsoft Installer), o Click-to-Run é projetado para ser mais eficiente, flexível e fácil de gerenciar. Aqui está uma visão geral de como o Click-to-Run funciona:
Office click to run was available with Office 2013 (OEM) so A cannot be right.
A é a resposta correta

Selected Answer: A
A is correct answer

comments.content: Well, far fetched but guess you are right because all other answers are more wrong.
A is correct. Proplus is now named Microsoft 365 apps for Enterprise: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/about-microsoft-365-apps

In addition, all answers B, C and D can be applied to both Office 365 and Office 2016, so I think there is no correct answer

choices.B: Installation can be completed by using System Center Configuration Manager.
choices.A: Installation can be completed by using Click-to-Run.

questions.question_text:
Your company is evaluating the differences between deployments of Office 365 ProPlus and Office 2016.
You need to determine the installation features of each deployment.
Which installation feature is unique to Office 365 ProPlus?

You use Microsoft 365 Usage Analytics.
You need to know the number of users who are active today and were also active last month.
Which adoption metric should you use?

discussion.content:
EnabledUsers - Number of users enabled to use the product in the month.
ActiveUsers - Number of users active in the month.
MoMReturningUsers - Number of users active in the month that were also active in the preceding month.
CumulativeActiveUsers - Number of users active in the month plus any preceding month.

MoMReturningUsers (Month over Month Returning Users) measures the number of unique users who have been active in the current month and were also active in the previous month. This metric provides a good indication of user engagement and retention over time.

EnabledUsers measures the number of licensed users who have access to Microsoft 365 services.

ActiveUsers measures the number of unique users who have interacted with a Microsoft 365 service during a given time period.

CumulativeActiveUsers measures the total number of unique users who have interacted with a Microsoft 365 service since the service was first deployed.

I have no idea the difference between
CumulativeActiveUsers
and
MoMReturningUsers

Para acompanhar quantos usuários estão ativos hoje e também estavam ativos no mês passado, você deve usar a métrica:

A. MoM Retornando Usuários

Essa métrica ("Month-over-Month Returning Users" ou "Usuários que retornam de um mês para o outro") é específica para medir a taxa de adoção e engajamento ao longo do tempo, fornecendo informações sobre usuários ativos em períodos consecutivos, como o mês passado e o mês atual.

As outras métricas mencionadas não se concentram na comparação entre períodos consecutivos ou não são específicas para rastrear usuários ativos ao longo do tempo.
Answer is correct
A, resposta a é a mais plausível.
Given the answers possible, the question is pretty ambiguous.
Answer is correct
Correct answer

MoMReturningUsers:
Number of users active in the month that were also active in the preceding month.

questions.question_text:
You are a Microsoft 365 administrator for a company. You use products that are in private preview, public preview, or general availability (GA).
You need to determine at which phases you can receive support from the Microsoft 365 admin center.
For which product phase or phases can you receive support?

discussion.content:
GA is correct.
This question explicitly mentions 'Microsoft 365 admin center', Public preview support is only available through Microsoft Customer Support Services.

I think it is GA only , as we need support from admin center. "You use the admin center to set up your organization in the cloud, manage users, manage subscriptions, etc" , it is not about a technical support that Ms offers for both GA and public, see one similar question, next one Q3 as well.

Selected Answer: D
Public Preview is supported my MS but is still in development

Selected Answer: D
When working with features in public preview, these features:

1-May have restricted or limited functionality. For example, the feature may only apply to one platform.
2-Typically go through feature changes before they're generally available (GA).
3-Are fully supported by Microsoft.

----------------------
Private preview is for evaluation purposes only. It might have other issues that were not yet discovered or fixed, except for the lack of SLA and formal support
--------
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-365/public-preview

Public preview "Are fully supported by Microsoft."
"Microsoft provides support for private preview features." https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/manage/stay-on-top-of-updates?view=o365-worldwide article updated in 08.24.

I'm so confused..

Normalmente, o suporte oficial do centro de administração do Microsoft 365 é fornecido apenas para produtos que atingiram a disponibilidade geral (GA). Portanto, a opção correta seria:

C. Somente GA

Isso significa que você receberá suporte para produtos que foram totalmente lançados e estão disponíveis para todos os usuários, não durante as fases de visualização privada ou visualização pública. As versões prévias geralmente têm suporte limitado e são destinadas a testes e feedback, enquanto o suporte completo é oferecido após o lançamento geral.

When working with features in public preview, these features:

May have restricted or limited functionality. For example, the feature may only apply to one platform.
Typically go through feature changes before they're generally available (GA).
Are fully supported by Microsoft.
May only be available in selected geographic regions or cloud environments. For example, the feature may not exist for Windows 365 Business Cloud PCs.
Individual features in preview may have more usage and support restrictions. If so, this information is typically noted in the feature documentation.

This article suggests support is provided for Public Preview... reference is to Windows 365

C. GA only.

The Microsoft 365 admin center provides support for products in the General Availability (GA) phase only. During the GA phase, the product is considered stable, feature-complete, and ready for production use. Microsoft provides comprehensive support and documentation for GA products through the admin center, including troubleshooting guides, knowledge base articles, and direct support channels.

Selected Answer: C
GA only

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. GA only.

The Microsoft 365 admin center provides support for products that are generally available (GA) only. Private preview and public preview products are not yet generally available and are still in the testing phase, so they are not fully supported. However, Microsoft may provide limited support for private and public preview products through preview-specific channels, such as the Microsoft Tech Community.

Question # 18 (Multiple Choice)

Your company purchased a Microsoft 365 subscription and a Microsoft Azure support plan. As part of your governance and risk framework, your company only implements Azure services that have Azure support available.

Which two services from Microsoft lifecycle can you implement?

A. Private preview
B. Public preview
C. General Availability (GA)
D. End of Support
 
Answer: B, C

Microsoft Customer Support Services will supply support services during this phase, but normal service level agreements do not apply. By clicking on the information banner customers then opt-in to the preview experience.

Selected Answer: C
Private preview – During this phase we invite a few customers to take part in early access to new concepts and features. This phase does not include formal support.
Public preview – During this phase we allow any customer with the proper Azure AD license to evaluate the new feature. Microsoft Customer Support Services will supply support services during this phase, but normal service level agreements do not apply. For new features exposed in the Azure AD Portal, customer can expect to see information banners in the user interface that draw attention to the new experience available during the preview. By clicking on the information banner customers then opt-in to the preview experience.
Generally available (GA) – After the public preview is completed, the feature is open for any licensed customer to use and is supported via all Microsoft support channels. Be aware when a new feature impacts existing functionality, it might change the way you or your users use the functionality.

https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/

Private preview – During this phase we invite a few customers to take part in early access to new concepts and features. This phase does not include formal support.
Public preview – During this phase we allow any customer with the proper Azure Communication Services license to evaluate the new feature. Microsoft will supply support services during this phase, but normal service level agreements do not apply. Public preview features are identified through information banners in documentation at docs.microsoft.com, or through "beta" or "pre-release" labels on the application programming interfaces and software development kits.
Generally available (GA) – After the public preview is completed, the feature is open for any licensed customer to use and is supported via all Microsoft support channels. Be aware when a new feature impacts existing functionality, it might change the way you or your users use the functionality.
